intro: Pedicularis luteola, commonly known as the yellow louse plant, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are slender and creeping. Pedicularis luteola is often found in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes.
